brisk.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: They set off at a brisk pace.
brisk.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: quick, practical, and showing that you want to get things done quickly
brisk.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Her tone of voice is brisk.
brisk.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: trade or business that is brisk is very busy, with a lot of products being sold
brisk.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The public bar was already doing a brisk trade.
brisk.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: weather that is brisk is cold and clear
brisk.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: business or trading that is brisk is very busy, with a lot of products, shares etc bought and sold
brisk.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Restaurants do brisk business at Thanksgiving.
Following several days of brisk trading, the junk bond market was quiet.
